segment.source: This article shows you how to enumerate MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) devices and send and receive MIDI messages from a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article shows you how to enumerate MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) devices and send and receive MIDI messages from a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: MIDI
segment.target: MIDI

segment.source: MIDI
segment.target: MIDI

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article shows you how to enumerate MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) devices and send and receive MIDI messages from a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article shows you how to enumerate MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) devices and send and receive MIDI messages from a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Enumerate MIDI devices
segment.target: Enumerate MIDI devices

segment.source: Before enumerating and using MIDI devices, add the following namespaces to your project.
segment.target: Before enumerating and using MIDI devices, add the following namespaces to your project.

segment.source: Using
segment.target: Using

segment.source: Add a ListBox control to your XAML page that will allow the user to select one of the MIDI input devices attached to the system.
segment.target: Add a ListBox control to your XAML page that will allow the user to select one of the MIDI input devices attached to the system.

segment.source: Add another one to list the MIDI output devices.
segment.target: Add another one to list the MIDI output devices.

segment.source: MidiListBoxes
segment.target: MidiListBoxes

segment.source: The FindAllAsync method DeviceInformation class is used to enumerate many different types of devices that are recognized by Windows.
segment.target: The FindAllAsync method DeviceInformation class is used to enumerate many different types of devices that are recognized by Windows.

segment.source: To specify that you only want the method to find MIDI input devices, use the selector string returned by MidiInPort.GetDeviceSelector.
segment.target: To specify that you only want the method to find MIDI input devices, use the selector string returned by MidiInPort.GetDeviceSelector.

segment.source: FindAllAsync returns a DeviceInformationCollection that contains a DeviceInformation for each MIDI input device registered with the system.
segment.target: FindAllAsync returns a DeviceInformationCollection that contains a DeviceInformation for each MIDI input device registered with the system.

segment.source: If the returned collection contains no items, then there are no available MIDI input devices.
segment.target: If the returned collection contains no items, then there are no available MIDI input devices.

segment.source: If there are items in the collection, loop through the DeviceInformation objects and add the name of each device to the MIDI input device ListBox.
segment.target: If there are items in the collection, loop through the DeviceInformation objects and add the name of each device to the MIDI input device ListBox.

segment.source: EnumerateMidiInputDevices
segment.target: EnumerateMidiInputDevices

segment.source: Enumerating MIDI output devices works the exact same way as enumerating input devices, except that you should specify the selector string returned by MidiOutPort.GetDeviceSelector when calling FindAllAsync.
segment.target: Enumerating MIDI output devices works the exact same way as enumerating input devices, except that you should specify the selector string returned by MidiOutPort.GetDeviceSelector when calling FindAllAsync.

segment.source: EnumerateMidiOutputDevices
segment.target: EnumerateMidiOutputDevices

segment.source: Create a device watcher helper class
segment.target: Create a device watcher helper class

segment.source: The Windows.Devices.Enumeration namespace provides the DeviceWatcher which can notify your app if devices are added or removed from the system, or if the information for a device is updated.
segment.target: The Windows.Devices.Enumeration namespace provides the DeviceWatcher which can notify your app if devices are added or removed from the system, or if the information for a device is updated.

segment.source: Since MIDI-enabled apps typically are interested in both input and output devices, this example creates a helper class that implements the DeviceWatcher pattern, so that the same code can be used for both MIDI input and MIDI output devices, without the need for duplication.
segment.target: Since MIDI-enabled apps typically are interested in both input and output devices, this example creates a helper class that implements the DeviceWatcher pattern, so that the same code can be used for both MIDI input and MIDI output devices, without the need for duplication.

segment.source: Add a new class to your project to serve as your device watcher.
segment.target: Add a new class to your project to serve as your device watcher.

segment.source: In this example the class is named MyMidiDeviceWatcher.
segment.target: In this example the class is named MyMidiDeviceWatcher.

segment.source: The rest of the code in this section is used to implement the helper class.
segment.target: The rest of the code in this section is used to implement the helper class.

segment.source: Add some member variables to the class:
segment.target: Add some member variables to the class:

segment.source: A DeviceWatcher object that will monitor for device changes.
segment.target: A DeviceWatcher object that will monitor for device changes.

segment.source: A device selector string that will contain the MIDI in port selector string for one instance and the MIDI out port selector string for another instance.
segment.target: A device selector string that will contain the MIDI in port selector string for one instance and the MIDI out port selector string for another instance.

segment.source: A ListBox control that will be populated with the names of the available devices.
segment.target: A ListBox control that will be populated with the names of the available devices.

segment.source: A CoreDispatcher that is required to update the UI from a thread other than the UI thread.
segment.target: A CoreDispatcher that is required to update the UI from a thread other than the UI thread.

segment.source: WatcherVariables
segment.target: WatcherVariables

segment.source: Add a DeviceInformationCollection property that is used to access the current list of devices from outside the helper class.
segment.target: Add a DeviceInformationCollection property that is used to access the current list of devices from outside the helper class.

segment.source: DeclareDeviceInformationCollection
segment.target: DeclareDeviceInformationCollection

segment.source: In class constructor, the caller passes in the MIDI device selector string, the ListBox for listing the devices, and the Dispatcher needed to update the UI.
segment.target: In class constructor, the caller passes in the MIDI device selector string, the ListBox for listing the devices, and the Dispatcher needed to update the UI.

segment.source: Call DeviceInformation.CreateWatcher to create a new instance of the DeviceWatcher class, passing in the MIDI device selector string.
segment.target: Call DeviceInformation.CreateWatcher to create a new instance of the DeviceWatcher class, passing in the MIDI device selector string.

segment.source: Register handlers for the watcher's event handlers.
segment.target: Register handlers for the watcher's event handlers.

segment.source: WatcherConstructor
segment.target: WatcherConstructor

segment.source: The DeviceWatcher has the following events:
segment.target: The DeviceWatcher has the following events:

segment.source: Added - Raised when a new device is added to the system.
segment.target: Added - Raised when a new device is added to the system.

segment.source: Removed - Raised when a device is removed from the system.
segment.target: Removed - Raised when a device is removed from the system.

segment.source: Updated - Raised when the information associated with an existing device is updated.
segment.target: Updated - Raised when the information associated with an existing device is updated.

segment.source: EnumerationCompleted - Raised when the watcher has completed its enumeration of the requested device type.
segment.target: EnumerationCompleted - Raised when the watcher has completed its enumeration of the requested device type.

segment.source: In the event handler for each of these events, a helper method, UpdateDevices, is called to update the ListBox with the current list of devices.
segment.target: In the event handler for each of these events, a helper method, UpdateDevices, is called to update the ListBox with the current list of devices.

segment.source: Because UpdateDevices updates UI elements and these event handlers are not called on the UI thread, each call must be wrapped in a call to RunAsync, which causes the specified code to be run on the UI thread.
segment.target: Because UpdateDevices updates UI elements and these event handlers are not called on the UI thread, each call must be wrapped in a call to RunAsync, which causes the specified code to be run on the UI thread.

segment.source: WatcherEventHandlers
segment.target: WatcherEventHandlers

segment.source: The UpdateDevices helper method calls DeviceInformation.FindAllAsync and updates the ListBox with the names of the returned devices as described previously in this article.
segment.target: The UpdateDevices helper method calls DeviceInformation.FindAllAsync and updates the ListBox with the names of the returned devices as described previously in this article.

segment.source: WatcherUpdateDevices
segment.target: WatcherUpdateDevices

segment.source: Add methods to start the watcher, using the DeviceWatcher object's Start method, and to stop the watcher, using the Stop method.
segment.target: Add methods to start the watcher, using the DeviceWatcher object's Start method, and to stop the watcher, using the Stop method.

segment.source: WatcherStopStart
segment.target: WatcherStopStart

segment.source: Provide a destructor to unregister the watcher event handlers and set the device watcher to null.
segment.target: Provide a destructor to unregister the watcher event handlers and set the device watcher to null.

segment.source: WatcherDestructor
segment.target: WatcherDestructor

segment.source: Create MIDI ports to send and receive messages
segment.target: Create MIDI ports to send and receive messages

segment.source: In the code behind for your page, declare member variables to hold two instances of the MyMidiDeviceWatcher helper class, one for input devices and one for output devices.
segment.target: In the code behind for your page, declare member variables to hold two instances of the MyMidiDeviceWatcher helper class, one for input devices and one for output devices.

segment.source: DeclareDeviceWatchers
segment.target: DeclareDeviceWatchers

segment.source: Create a new instance of the watcher helper classes, passing in the device selector string, the ListBox to be populated, and the CoreDispatcher object that can be accessed through the page's Dispatcher property.
segment.target: Create a new instance of the watcher helper classes, passing in the device selector string, the ListBox to be populated, and the CoreDispatcher object that can be accessed through the page's Dispatcher property.

segment.source: Then, call the method to start each object's DeviceWatcher.
segment.target: Then, call the method to start each object's DeviceWatcher.

segment.source: Shortly after each DeviceWatcher is started, it will finish enumerating the current devices connected to the system and raise its EnumerationCompleted event, which will cause each ListBox to be updated with the current MIDI devices.
segment.target: Shortly after each DeviceWatcher is started, it will finish enumerating the current devices connected to the system and raise its EnumerationCompleted event, which will cause each ListBox to be updated with the current MIDI devices.

segment.source: StartWatchers
segment.target: StartWatchers

segment.source: Shortly after each DeviceWatcher is started, it will finish enumerating the current devices connected to the system and raise its EnumerationCompleted event, which will cause each ListBox to be updated with the current MIDI devices.
segment.target: Shortly after each DeviceWatcher is started, it will finish enumerating the current devices connected to the system and raise its EnumerationCompleted event, which will cause each ListBox to be updated with the current MIDI devices.

segment.source: When the user selects an item in the MIDI input ListBox, the SelectionChanged event is raised.
segment.target: When the user selects an item in the MIDI input ListBox, the SelectionChanged event is raised.

segment.source: In the handler for this event, access the DeviceInformationCollection property of the helper class to get the current list of devices.
segment.target: In the handler for this event, access the DeviceInformationCollection property of the helper class to get the current list of devices.

segment.source: If there are entries in the list, select the DeviceInformation object with the index corresponding to the ListBox control's SelectedIndex.
segment.target: If there are entries in the list, select the DeviceInformation object with the index corresponding to the ListBox control's SelectedIndex.

segment.source: Create the MidiInPort object representing the selected input device by calling MidiInPort.FromIdAsync, passing in the Id property of the selected device.
segment.target: Create the MidiInPort object representing the selected input device by calling MidiInPort.FromIdAsync, passing in the Id property of the selected device.

segment.source: Register a handler for the MessageReceived event, which is raised whenever a MIDI message is received through the specified device.
segment.target: Register a handler for the MessageReceived event, which is raised whenever a MIDI message is received through the specified device.

segment.source: InPortSelectionChanged
segment.target: InPortSelectionChanged

segment.source: When the MessageReceived handler is called, the message is contained in the Message property of the MidiMessageReceivedEventArgs.
segment.target: When the MessageReceived handler is called, the message is contained in the Message property of the MidiMessageReceivedEventArgs.

segment.source: The Type of the message object is a value from the MidiMessageType enumeration indicating the type of message that was received.
segment.target: The Type of the message object is a value from the MidiMessageType enumeration indicating the type of message that was received.

segment.source: The data of the message depends on the type of the message.
segment.target: The data of the message depends on the type of the message.

segment.source: This example checks to see if the message is a note on message and, if so, outputs the midi channel, note, and velocity of the message.
segment.target: This example checks to see if the message is a note on message and, if so, outputs the midi channel, note, and velocity of the message.

segment.source: MessageReceived
segment.target: MessageReceived

segment.source: The SelectionChanged handler for the output device ListBox works the same as the handler for input devices, except no event handler is registered.
segment.target: The SelectionChanged handler for the output device ListBox works the same as the handler for input devices, except no event handler is registered.

segment.source: OutPortSelectionChanged
segment.target: OutPortSelectionChanged

segment.source: Once the output device is created, you can send a message by creating a new IMidiMessage for the type of message you want to send.
segment.target: Once the output device is created, you can send a message by creating a new IMidiMessage for the type of message you want to send.

segment.source: In this example, the message is a NoteOnMessage.
segment.target: In this example, the message is a NoteOnMessage.

segment.source: The SendMessage method of the IMidiOutPort object is called to send the message.
segment.target: The SendMessage method of the IMidiOutPort object is called to send the message.

segment.source: SendMessage
segment.target: SendMessage

segment.source: When your app is deactivated, be sure to clean up your apps resources.
segment.target: When your app is deactivated, be sure to clean up your apps resources.

segment.source: Unregister your event handlers and set the MIDI in port and out port objects to null.
segment.target: Unregister your event handlers and set the MIDI in port and out port objects to null.

segment.source: Stop the device watchers and set them to null.
segment.target: Stop the device watchers and set them to null.

segment.source: CleanUp
segment.target: CleanUp

segment.source: Using the built-in Windows General MIDI synth
segment.target: Using the built-in Windows General MIDI synth

segment.source: When you enumerate output MIDI devices using the technique described above, your app will discover a MIDI device called "Microsoft GS Wavetable Synth".
segment.target: When you enumerate output MIDI devices using the technique described above, your app will discover a MIDI device called "Microsoft GS Wavetable Synth".

segment.source: This is a built-in General MIDI synthesizer that you can play from your app.
segment.target: This is a built-in General MIDI synthesizer that you can play from your app.

segment.source: However, attempting to create a MIDI outport to this device will fail unless you have included the SDK extension for the built-in synth in your project.
segment.target: However, attempting to create a MIDI outport to this device will fail unless you have included the SDK extension for the built-in synth in your project.

segment.source: To include the General MIDI Synth SDK extension in your app project
segment.target: To include the General MIDI Synth SDK extension in your app project

segment.source: In Solution Explorer, under your project, right-click References and select Add reference...
segment.target: In Solution Explorer, under your project, right-click References and select Add reference...

segment.source: Expand the Universal Windows node.
segment.target: Expand the Universal Windows node.

segment.source: Select Extensions.
segment.target: Select Extensions.

segment.source: From the list of extensions, select Microsoft General MIDI DLS for Universal Windows Apps.
segment.target: From the list of extensions, select Microsoft General MIDI DLS for Universal Windows Apps.

segment.source: Note If there are multiple versions of the extension, be sure to select the version that matches the target for your app.
segment.target: Note If there are multiple versions of the extension, be sure to select the version that matches the target for your app.

segment.source: You can see which SDK version your app is targeting on the Application tab of the project Properties.
segment.target: You can see which SDK version your app is targeting on the Application tab of the project Properties.
